comments.author: mounir@lamouri.fr
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> So why is aIgnoreSelf actually needed, by the way?

When an element is removed from a group, it might change the group validity but when it's removed, we don't know the container anymore. The more straightforward solution was to call UpdateValueMissingForRadioGroup() and asking to just ignores self.

I think a better solution would be to make the container update the radio elements validity itself: when a radio element has changed in a way that could make the validity changed, it would call the container and tell him to update its validity. If it has changed, it would do what we currently do (update all radio elements in the group).
